title.jp: Kore kara ga Kanojo-tachi no Hajimari

synopsis: Shown from a perspective of a cameraman shooting a documentary, it films and introduces the girls of 765 Production studios and their everyday activities as an idol. Along with interviews with the staff of 765 Production, the idols themselves are also interviewed over why they became idols and their goals. By the end of the episode, President Junjirou Takagi of 765 Production reveals to the girls that the cameraman that's been filming them is in fact their new producer.

After seeing the girls current profile pictures, the Producer decides that they need new ones and orders a re-shoot so the girls can get a better impression in their auditions. While the photo shoot is currently in session, the younger idols, Iori, Yayoi, Ami and Mami want to stand out from the rest of the older idols by appearing mature-looking, which they fail to do so. However, the Producer, Miki, Azusa and Ritsuko teach the younger girls about individuality and to just be themselves. Thanks to their advice, the girls photo shoot becomes a success.

title.jp: Subete wa Ippo no Yuuki kara

synopsis: The Producer and the girls head to the town of Furusato to perform a mini concert at the town's Summer Festival, where some of the girls are disappointed to learn the festival's stage is small and they also have to help out the town's folk in preparing the festival. Unfortunately for Yukiho, she is afraid of the town's men due to her androphobia, making her lose her confidence in performing a practice song with Makoto and Haruka. On the night of the town's Summer Festival, Makoto and Haruka manage to help Yukiho overcome her fear of men and just when it looks like she can do it, Yukiho runs away upon learning that one member of the audience has a dog, another thing she is afraid of. The Producer counsels Yukiho that he will handle the dog, which she later realizes that the Producer is afraid of dogs as well but chooses to get over his fears to help her. His courage gives Yukiho confidence where she, Makoto and Haruka are able to make a great performance to the crowd. After everyone returns to 765 Production studios, the Producer finds a souvenir of Furusato's pickled plums on his desk by Yukiho as thanks for helping her.

title.jp: Jibun wo Kaeru to Iu Koto

synopsis: Haruka, Chihaya, Takane and Hibiki appear on a cable TV cooking show competition hosted by a frog hand puppet. However, Chihaya reveals to the Producer she's disappointed that there will be no singing in this show, which the Producer responds to by telling her to bear with it. As Haruka and Chihaya duel against Takane and Hibiki in the show, the host makes fun of the girls' mistakes. When Chihaya has enough and calls him out on his behavior, the studio goes silent until Haruka breaks it and the shows resumes as normal. As the show takes a break, Chihaya disappears, much to the Producer's worry, until he finds her outside singing. After calming herself, the Producer apologizes to her and promises to get her jobs with singing, and Haruka, Takane and Hibiki help Chihaya's awkwardness on the show by telling her to give her heart to the audience just like how she does with her songs. Thanks to their advice, Chihaya improves and the second part of the show is a success. As the Producer takes the girls out for dinner, Chihaya decides to go home but not before the Producer gives her band-aids for the cuts she got from the show. After learning from the girls that Chihaya lives alone due to family circumstances, the Producer realizes he needs to know more about the idols if he wants to help them.

It's summer and the idols are having a miserable time as the studio's air conditioner is broken. To give time for the air conditioner to be fixed and have the girls rest, the Producer agrees to bring the girls to the beach for a vacation. As everyone enjoys their time on the beach in their own way, back at 765 Production Studios, office clerk Kotori Otonashi receives an important call from President Junjirou. By the time nightfall arrives, the Producer and the idols stay at a local inn where they enjoy a barbeque, taking an outdoor bath and play games. As everyone goes to sleep, Haruka, Chihaya, Makoto and Iori have some small talk about their vacation and where their careers be in a year. After everyone comes back to the studio with the air conditioner fixed, President Junjirou makes an announcement that he has approved Ritsuko as producer for "Project Ryuuguu Komachi".

title.jp: Saki ni Susumu to Iu Sentaku

synopsis: Ritsuko's idol unit, Ryuuguu Komachi, with Azusa, Iori and Ami as its members, becomes popular after their debut and gets booked in many gigs including singing on a music television program. But the Producer, worried over the other idols popularity, decides to have the idols audition several gigs so not to lose to Ryuuguu Komachi. However, he is so worried over having the girls attend their scheduled gigs that some of the girls are forced to rest for various reasons. As well, he accidentally double-books Hibiki to a concert with Makoto when Hibiki is actually with him and Haruka at another event. Luckily, Miki is able to substitute for Hibiki at the concert. The Producer realizes his mistakes over panicking over the girls' fame and apologizes to Kotori and the girls. As everyone at 765 Studios watches Ryuuguu Komachi's performance on television, the Producer tells Ritsuko that he will do better to help the idols.

title.jp: Daisuki na Mono, Taisetsu na Mono

synopsis: Iori humiliates herself on live television when she forces an interviewer at the Minase estate to focus on her rather than talk about her father and older brothers. While the Producer reprimands her actions, Iori ignores his advice. Yayoi invites Iori and Hibiki to her home to have dinner with her five younger siblings where Iori learns about the life of a "commoner" and gets to know Yayoi's brother and the eldest boy, Chōsuke, who wants to help his older sister. During dinner, Chōsuke hits his brother Kōji for trying to take his food, for which Yayoi tells him to apologize, but he angrily talks back to her and runs away. Worried about Chōsuke, Yayoi and Hibiki tries searching for him around town and is later joined by the Producer after Iori calls him. Iori soon figures out where Chōsuke is and finds him in the storage shed as that is where she hides when she fought with her brothers. Iori understand what it feels like to be a younger sibling and knows that Chōsuke just wanted to help his sister and gives him the advice that instead of just complaining and running away, he should be bold, confront his sister and tell the truth. Inspired by Iori's speech, Chōsuke reunites with Yayoi and apologizes. As the Producer, Hibiki and Iori go home, he thanks Iori for calling him for help. The next morning, Yayoi learns to her surprise that Chōsuke wants to become more reliable at home.

Azusa, Makoto and Miki go modeling as a Bride, Groom and Bridesmaid respectively for a wedding magazine in a chapel. While Azusa is having a chat with her friend on the phone, a runaway bride who doesn't want to be married in an arranged marriage bumps into Azusa and drops her engagement ring. Azusa picks it up and is then taken by a group of bodyguards who mistake her for the runaway bride. But Azusa's kidnapping is witnessed by Makoto, and the Producer and her chase after them, leaving Miki behind at the job. When the bodyguards realize they have the wrong person, they let Azusa go but only to later learn from the bride that the ring is with Azusa. As Azusa tries to find her way back, she helps several people along the way, including watching over a fortune teller's booth, and while doing that, directing a Middle Eastern Man to go to the harbor. After a fight between Makoto and the bodyguards in Chinatown, they soon learn where Azusa is and immediately run after her, the whole group growing to include the Producer, the bride, the shop owners whose shops were damaged in the fight and the people Azusa helped. Coincidentally, Miki and the photo crew have moved to where Azusa and everyone else is heading, and Miki convinces the photographer to take pictures of the wild chase. After the misunderstandings are cleared and the ring finally returned, the bodyguard's boss arrives who is none other than the man Azusa met earlier, who is actually an Middle Eastern Oil Tycoon. The bride, finally seeing that the groom is actually a handsome and kind man, happily agrees to marry him and hopes Azusa will find happiness as well. Thankfully for everyone at 765 Productions, Azusa's chase photos become a hit and the Oil Tycoon paid for all of the damages cause by the misunderstandings.

After finishing filming a TV mystery mini-drama, Ryuuguu Komachi and Ritsuko returns to 765 studios for a break with Mami and the Producer returning as well. Iori decides to treat everyone to some special pudding she bought and kept in the refrigerator earlier, but finds the puddings are gone. Suspecting the other idols as the culprits, Ami and Mami decide to solve the mystery by playing detectives. As the twins investigate and interrogate the others with their antics, Mami admits to the Producer she feels bored and lonely without her sister but hopes to be famous like Ami and be together again. After clearing almost everyone as suspects, the twins have everyone in the studio pull a scary stunt on Haruka, Chihaya and Miki which reveals Miki as the real culprit. With the case over, Miki explains she ate the pudding because someone ate her jelly dessert earlier that morning, which the twins inadvertently reveal they were the ones who ate it, much to the office's anger as the whole thing was their fault in the first place. Makoto also mentions noticing other things going missing from the fridge lately, which angers everyone else even further, causing the twins to be chased. In the epilogue, Miki reveals there was only one pudding in the fridge when she ate it as unknown to everyone, Azusa actually ate all of the puddings that morning despite being on a diet.

title.jp: Minna de, Sukoshi demo Mae e

synopsis: The girls attend "The Big Talent Agency Sports Competition" where idols groups from various agencies compete in games. Despite the animosity between Makoto and Iori and not all of them winning first place, the girls remain optimistic which wins them favorable views from the crowd. However, Shinkan Shoujo, a rival idol group, does not like the attention 765 Pro is getting and proceed to insult them, with one of them even calling Yayoi a burden to the agency which deeply affects her confidence. After the girls watch a performance by the boy band Jupiter and later lunch with Ai Hidaka, Eri Mizutani and Ryo Akizuki, the idols from 876 Production Studios, Makoto and Iori compete in another three legged race much to their displeasure, during which, due to their lack of teamwork, Makoto injures her knee. At first the girls decide that Makoto should pull out of the competition but when they learn what Shinkan Shoujo said to Yayoi, the girls are now more determined to win the next and final event, the Relay race. Their determination emboldens the Producer who refuses to be intimidated by Shinkan Shoujo's producer who is trying to pressure 765 Pro to lose on purpose so that his idol unit will win the competition. The latter is forced to back off and play fair after Iori reminds him that her family is the major stockholder for the parent company that owns Shinkan Shoujo's agency. As the girls work together in the race, Makoto is able to win first place thanks to a reconfident Yayoi. With the games over, Ryuuguu Komachi wins the Idol category but decide to share their trophy with the rest of the girls of 765 Studios which they celebrate back at their studio together with the idols of 876 Studios.

The Producer informs the girls that their big break has come as they will be performing live at a 765 Pro Thank You Concert. Despite it's main event being Ryuuguu Komachi, the girls are excited since they will be performing a new song and dance routine. However, the girls have to go through tough dance and vocal lessons which some of the girls are having problems doing it right, especially since their exams are coming out. When Yukiho feels like quitting for not catching up in dancing, Takane encourages her not to give up and be more determined. Inspired by Takane, Chihaya decides to help Haruka's vocal training at night which forces her to stay at Chihaya's apartment. While helping making dinner, Haruka learns Chihaya lives alone due to her parents divorce and Chihaya learns that becoming an idol is Haruka's dream. Thanks to their hardwork and determination, the girls finally perfect their singing and dance routine. Due to a misunderstanding between her and the Producer some time ago, Miki believes she is now talented enough to join Ryuuguu Komachi but Ritsuko explains to a dejected Miki why she can't. The next day, the girls' exams are over and are preparing for their next dance lesson but Miki has not arrived, and as they notice her absence, the Producer receives a message from her calling him a liar.

Miki hasn't come for practice sessions for the past few days much to the worry of the Producer and the idols as the day of the concert gets closer. After Ritsuko explains about the talk she had with Miki about the misunderstanding over Ryuuguu Komachi, the Producer realizes what happen and tries to call her to come back and stop being selfish but Miki tells him she no longer has the enthusiasm to perform before ending the call. Kotori calms the Producer down since Miki is still a teenager which makes him realize his mistake of treating her like a professional and never considering her feelings. As the Producer searches for Miki around the city, the idols begin to have doubts if Miki will return but Chihaya is convince she will come back and they should continue practicing. After the Producer finally finds and apologizes Miki and asks her to come back, Miki reveals she wants to quit being an idol as she lost her enthusiasm upon learning she can't join Ryuuguu Komachi. As the Producer follows her around the city trying to make her reconsider, they stop at a lake where she reveals she work hard during the practice sessions hoping to join Ryuuguu Komachi so she could wear cool costumes, be on stage and popular just like them. But the Producer tells her things have change since now it's the rest of other idols turn to be in the spotlight so he makes a promise with her that he will help her become just like or better than Ryuuguu Komachi if she promises to return to 765 Pro with the same enthusiasm she had. Back at 765 Studios, Miki apologizes to everyone for her absence but Chihaya has no time to hear it as she wants Miki make up for lost time. Glad to have her back, the idols watch as Miki tries on her new costume.

title.jp: Soshite, Kanojo-tachi wa Kirameku Stage e

synopsis: It's the day of the 765 Pro Thank You Concert but complications arise for Ritsuko and Ryuuguu Komachi when a Typhoon hits the city, leading all transit trains to be stopped, forcing Ritsuko and the others to drive to the concert only to get into a traffic jam. With the audience now arriving at the concert, the Producer orders a change of plans to the backstage crew and the idols to have them perform first to buy enough time for Ryuuguu Komachi to arrive. At first, the concert is doing fine until the audience starts to feel bored and wonders where Ryuuguu Komachi are. Backstage, Hibiki, Makoto, Mami, Yukiho and Yayoi starts to panic but Haruka manages to calm them and tells them to give excitement to the audience which they do. However a problem arises when the Producer learns that they have mistakenly ordered for Miki to perform two consecutive songs, both requiring intensive dance performances. Despite how exhausting it will be doing two songs without rest, Miki is determined to do it. An exhausted Miki succeeds in performing both songs amazingly which the Producer, Chihaya and Haruka praises her. Performing one more song, the idols give it their best where Ryuuguu Komachi finally arrives at the concert. After the end of the concert, Ritsuko, Ami, Azusa and Iori go backstage to see the others only to find them sleeping from exhaustion and being watched over the Producer, President Junjirou and Kotori. Despite that, they congratulate their friends on a great job.

Ever since the concert and an article by Yoshizawa, a famous reporter who is a friend of President Junjirou, the idols have become very popular to the point of wearing disguises in public. After appearing on a TV show and going back to their makeup room, Haruka and Yayoi encounter Jupiter who's leader, Touma Amagase gives them an ominous warning. Back at 765 Pro studio, everyone is waiting for a magazine which features a photo shoot of the idols on the cover but Iori brings it, showing instead Jupiter on the cover. Wanting to know wants going on, President Junjirou and Yoshizawa believes this was the work of 961 Pro studio President and Jupiter's manager, Takao Kuroi, who used his connections to have the magazine cover changed. Kuroi and Junjirou were once friends in the idol industry but both of them had a falling out because Junjirou disapproved of Kuroi's methods. Because of the 765 Pro idols recent popularity, Kuroi wants revenge against Junjirou by crushing his idols using Jupiter. The girls want revenge but the Producer, Ritsuko and Junjirou tells them they shouldn't fight dirty and stoop as low as Kuroi and if they wish beat him, they should do it fair and square. As the idols are still upset over the magazine cover, Haruka helps Kotori arrange their fan letters which the others later joined. Thanks to the encouraging letters from their fans, the idols realize it is their fans that should be winning over rather than their rivalry with 961 Pro and all of them agree to work hard for them.

title.jp: Minna Sorotte, Namahousou Desu yo Namahousou!

synopsis: The 765 Pro idols star in a comedy variety show called "Are We Live? Sunday", hosted by Haruka, Chihaya and Miki. Other segments on the show include Hibiki's challenge (running from a distance to reach the studio in time), Azusa, Yayoi and Iori with kindergarteners, Yukiho helping Makoto trying on clothes, Takane going out tasting ramen with Ami and Mami and a trailer of the idols upcoming action mecha movie. But soon comedic situations abound when Haruka accidentally smacks herself on the face trying to open an ice cream box, forcing Chihaya to hold her laughter, Miki trying to flirt the Producer much to his and Ritsuko's chagrin, Yukiho forcing a helpless Makoto to try on male clothes, Yayoi messing up the weather report, Ami and Mami unable to finish the ramen Takane ordered and Hibiki getting lost. By the end of the show, it revealed Kotori was watching it at her home.

As Chihaya has nightmares about her past, Hibiki has an argument with her dog, Inumi, as both of them are hosting an animal documentary show. Meanwhile, Kuroi plots to foil Hibiki's role as the presenter of the show by replacing Inumi's role with a less well-behaved dog. As Jupiter are brought on as guests to the show, one of 961 Pro's henchmen arranges for Hibiki to be secretly taken elsewhere and left stranded on the side of a cliff so that hosting duties will be given to Jupiter. As the Producer searches for Hibiki, her hamster, Hamuzou, travels to the 765 Pro office to get help from Inumi and the other idols. As Hibiki realizes she hasn't been able to spend time with her pets due to her busy lifestyle, Inumi and the other animals arrive to help her. As the Producer discover Kuroi's role in Hibiki's disappearance, Hibiki and her animal friends arrive in time to film the show much to Kuroi's anger who abandons his henchman. Now having a better understanding with her pets, Hibiki hosts the show with them.

Makoto is a hit with female fans due to her handsome and Prince-like looks. While Makoto appreciates the fame, she wishes fans admire her as a girl not a boy. After appearing on talk show along with Jupiter, Makoto almost has a fight with Touma, who the latter believes in the lies Kuroi tells him until the Producer intervenes. However, Kuroi appears himself who not only mocks 765 Pro but makes fun on Makoto and her tomboyish looks. To let out her anger, Makoto goes on a "date" with the Producer at an Amusement Park where she reveals because her father raise her as a boy, she never experience doing girly things so she became an idol to shed her tomboy image to become a princess. When a group of thugs start harassing two girls, Makoto goes to stop them only for the girls, who Makoto fans, go happy with excitement upon meeting their idol and ignoring the thugs. Angry, one of the thugs tries to punch Makoto only to hit the Producer instead which attracts the attention of more Makoto fangirls, forcing the thugs to leave. After recovering from his injuries, the Producer teaches Makoto that her dreams of being a princess is great but she is also fulling the dreams of her fangirls who wishes to meet a prince as well and as a gift, they ride the Merry-go-round with the Producer treating her as a princess. Appreciating to act like a girl for a day, Makoto tells the Producer she will continue with her Prince image for her fans and hopes one day to meet her Prince Charming who will finally treat her as the Princess she is.

Ritsuko forces a hard dancing routine on Ryūgū Komachi to prepare them for an upcoming secret concert much to the group's displeasure. While checking out Ryūgū Komachi's fan letters, the Producer finds one with a picture of Ritsuko when she was an idol sent by a fan of hers nickname "Petit Bellpepper" much to her embarrassment. Upon learning Azusa won't be able to perform due to the mumps, Iori and Ami have a brilliant idea to have Ritsuko take over Azusa's place since she's the only one who's know the song and dance routine much to her horror. With the Producer and Miki supporting the idea much to her displeasure, Ritsuko is forced to do dance training which to Iori and Ami pleasure, they take advantage of it to get back at her. On the day of the concert, Ritsuko gets stage fright and is too nervous until Iori and Ami shows a prerecorded message by Azusa to the crowd where the group thanks Ritsuko for being their producer and a surprise appearance by "Petit Bellpepper" and Ritsuko's fanclub who have come to support Ritsuko thanks to the Producer. With her stage fright gone, Ristuko is able to perform with Iori and Ami. After the concert, Ritsuko realize how much has change when she was an idol compare to Ryūgū Komachi but she still wants to be a producer to lead Ryūgū Komachi to the top. However, she does tell the Producer if she ever does a comeback as an idol, she wants him to be her producer. Now with Azusa back, Ritsuko continues the group's regular training for their rise to the top.

title.jp: Kumoma ni Kakureru Tsuki no Gotoku

synopsis: Kuroi hires a paparazzi to follow and take pictures of Takane to find secrets about her as her background is a complete mystery, even to everyone at 765 Pro studios. By coincidence, Takane bumps into the owner of Elder Records who treats her for lunch which the paparazzi takes pictures of the two which the entertainment industry interprets Takane is transferring to Elder Records. The Producer and Takane explains to the girls that the story isn't true much to their relief and suggests not commenting about it until the owner of Elder Records returns overseas to clarify to the public as well. However, the girls become suspicious of Takane's behavior and try to keep an eye on her. While visiting a festival, Chihaya admits to Takane they were actually following her as they don't know anything about her which Takane understands as everyone has secrets to keep for themselves just like Chihaya herself. At 961 Pro, Tōma finally learns of the dirty tricks that Kuroi has been using against 765 Pro while the latter takes an interest of a picture of Chihaya visiting a grave and arguing with her mother. At an event where Takane becomes Police Chief for a day, Takane and the Producer are able to catch the paparazzi after the owner of Elder Records came to apologize to Takane and clarify the truth to the public, ending the transfer story. As 765 Pro celebrate, Takane explains to everyone that her suspicious behavior was because she was contacting the Producer if she ever felt someone was following her. However, Kuroi has exposed Chihaya's private life in a magazine which shocks Chihaya that she loses her voice in rehearsal.

Chihaya's tragic past is revealed in a magazine no thanks to Kuroi which reveals that Chihaya had a younger brother named Yū who died in car accident when she was eight but the magazine slanders her, suggesting the shocked Chihaya who was there did nothing and was heartless and was also responsible for her parents divorce. Chihaya reveals to Haruka that she became an idol to sing in memory of her late brother who loved her singing but because of the revelation of her past has traumatize her that she is unable to sing, Chihaya wants to leave 765 Pro studios. As the days past, Chihaya refuses to leave her apartment, much to everyone's worries. Haruka tries her best to help Chihaya but Chihaya scolds her for being a busybody. After receiving Yū's sketchbook by Chihaya's mother to give to Chihaya herself, Haruka asks the Producer if she's just a bother for trying to help everyone but he assures her she isn't as it was her enthusiasm that help him when he was down. After reading Yū's sketchbook, Haruka and Miki have an idea to help Chihaya. Everyone at 765 Pro wrote and sent a song for Chihaya about their feelings to her which they hope she would sing it at the 765 Pro Autumn concert and Yū's sketchbook which Haruka reveals that what made her brother happy wasn't her singing but seeing Chihaya smile. On the day of the Autumn concert, just when it looks like Chihaya won't make it for her part, Chihaya finally arrives much to everyone's relief. As the music to her song begins, Chihaya is still unable to sing until Haruka and the rest of the idols sing the song for her. With their help and seeing her past self and little brother, Chihaya is finally able to overcome her trauma and finish the song herself. As the crowd applaud her, everyone cries with Chihaya in celebration.

title.jp: Maru de Hana ga Saku You ni

synopsis: Thanks to an magazine interview by Yoshizawa with Chihaya over her past, the rumors about her have ended as she and the other idols prepare for the Idol Jam concert with Jupiter performing as well. However, Kuroi refuses to give up on destroying 765 Pro so he sabotages them by tricking their hair and makeup stylists from not coming and forcing the sound technician not to play their music and lie to them that their music data has been corrupted. Despite this, the Producer goes with the sound technician with a backup data and the girls decide to do makeup themselves while planning an impromptu session before Chihaya goes on stage. While Chihaya thanks her friends for caring about her, she ask them to let her sing her song in a capella. With the crowd moved and praising her performance, the sound technician decides to not give in to Kuroi and play her music. Jupiter, who were also watching, which Tōma realizes that Kuroi sabotaged Chihaya song and confronts him. Having enough with Kuroi's methods and treating everyone as pawns, Jupiter decides to quit 961 Pro. After the concert, Jupiter meets the Producer with Tōma apologizing for his past behavior and tells him that they're quitting 961 Pro. To celebrate, Junjirō takes everyone out to a restaurant which to everyone's surprise, not only is Yoshizawa and Kuroi are at the bar, but Kotori is singing to the customers, revealing she was once an idol under Junjirō and Kuroi. As Junjirō has a drink with Yoshizawa and Kuroi while talking about their past, Kuroi leaves which Yoshizawa and Junjirō commenting Kuroi is someone who can't express his feelings well. As everyone heads home, the girls comment on how wonderful Kotori's song was and wondering if she ever had her own dreams of continuing an idol which Kotori tells the Producer and Ritsuko that she's simply happy just singing every once in a while and watching the others become top idols.

It's the Christmas season and Haruka wants to celebrate a Christmas Eve Party with everyone at 765 Pro just like last year. But with the idols' new fame, all of the girls are busy attending and performing at TV shows, Variety Shows, Holiday or Christmas Specials on Christmas Eve and most of them might not make it in time. Nevertheless, the Producer assures Haruka that he will try his best to get everyone for the party. During her dancing sessions, Haruka learns from the Producer that he has manage to get both she and Miki audition for the musical Spring Storm for the lead role. On Christmas Eve and finishing her work, Haruka accepts not everyone can make it for the party and decide to make the best of it. After buying a cake and a Christmas present for the Producer, Haruka arrives at 765 Pro studios with Chihaya and much to their surprise, some of the idols managed to make it for the party thanks to the Producer rescheduling their gigs. With the Producer and Miki the last to arrive, everyone eats the cakes they all bought and celebrate Christmas including Yukiho's birthday, until Junjirō announces to everyone that he has just received a call that Miki has won the Shining Idol New Artist Award. As the party continues, Haruka has a talk with Makoto, Iori and Chihaya on how their careers have changed and they might not be able celebrate together like this again but Chihaya and Haruka are still hopeful that all of them can still celebrate Christmas together.

Haruka is looking forward to a dance rehearsal with everyone for their New Year's concert, their last concert for this year. However, the girls of 765 Pro are too busy due to their schedules to do the rehearsal which Haruka takes it with good stride. But as the days continue when Chihaya leaves for an overseas recording, the idols are still unable to attend their rehearsals for the New Year's concert that slowly makes Haruka lonely and depressed as she is unable to practice with her friends. Not making things any better, Are We Live? Sunday is being cancelled to free up the Sunday timeslot for other shows and Miki is taking her audition for the musical seriously and treats Haruka as a rival. As Haruka feels down on the second day of the musical audition, the Producer arrives with Dorayaki to support her and Miki. As the Producer ask Haruka if she has any problem and wants to talk about it, Miki interrupts their talk. After dealing with Miki, the Producer wants to continue his talk with Haruka but tries to avoid the subject. As she tries to walk away from the Producer, Haruka almost fall into a hole on stage but is pull to safety by the Producer only to fall himself much to the shock of the crew on stage. As the Producer is sent to the emergency room, Junjirō, Ritsuko, Kotori, Miki and Haruka solemnly and sadly wait.

The producer manages to survive his accident, but must be hospitalized for a while. As a result, Haruka returns to musical rehearsals who channels her grief into her role and wins the lead role from Miki. Desperate to the get the idols together, Haruka asks Ritsuko to reschedule or cancel her current gigs so she can practice for the New Year's concert, but Ritsuko cannot do it. Miki overhears this and berates Haruka for being selfish, especially after she seized the main role in the musical, and asks Haruka why she wanted to become an idol in the first place. Haruka loses what little confidence she had left and breaks down when she realize she doesn't even remember why she became an idol. With Haruka given rest from her work, her friends begin worrying about her. A few days later, Haruka does an errand for her mother until she meets Tōma and Jupiter who are under a new company where they get to know their stage crew thanks to what she and 765 Pro taught them. After consulting with the hospitalized Producer, Chihaya gathers the rest of the idols and tells them why Haruka wanted to do dance rehearsal with everyone; Haruka realize everyone was drifting afar and losing their true selves due to their work and she wanted to do the rehearsal to reunite the bonds they always had. Meanwhile, Haruka meets a group of kindergarteners and sings with them until she remembers why she became an idol when she sees a younger self of her who brings her to the stadium where the 765 Pro Thank You Concert was held. Haruka remembers that she became an idol to sing, dance and make people happy together with her friends which her younger self, now looking older when she became an idol, ensures Haruka that her friends believe in her. As Haruka runs back to 765 Pro studios, the idols make a live broadcast announcing their New Year's concert and apologizing to Haruka of not realizing what she was doing. Happy to see this, Haruka reunites with her friends.

Kotori visits the Producer at the hospital who expresses his wish to see the idols at the New Year's concert. As the idols of 765 Pro prepares themselves for the concert, the girls gets a surprise visit by the Producer who manage to sneak out thanks to Kotori. The Producer gives the idols some words of encouragement especially to Haruka as he apologize for not noticing her problem earlier. The concert beginning, the idols first sing a remix of their song "Ready!! & Change!!!" much to the crowds joy. After doing a short talk to their audience, the idols announce they will be performing their new song with Ritsuko on stage, who they manage to tricked and convince to perform with them. Singing their new song, the girls get a huge applause from the crowd while the Producer, Kotori and Junjirō looks from backstage with pride and how much the girls have grown. As spring arrives, the idols greet the Producer who had just been released from the hospital at 765 Pro studios where he learns that not only has Are We Live? Sunday have been renewed, Haruka and Miki's musical will be performing nationwide but Junjirō also has bought a new office building for everyone using the company's earnings. But everyone at 765 Pro gets a nasty surprise when they realize they've been scammed by Kuroi when they learn he owns the company that is building their new office, which has just declared bankruptcy. Despite this setback, everyone still looks at the future with confidence as they celebrate Hanami. The series ends with Jupiter performing one of their concerts, the 876 Pro idols being interviewed by Yoshizawa and everyone at 765 Pro getting their picture taken by Junjirō.
